results.question: What is the pattern of the type 'mineral'?
results.expected_answer: angular, with sharp angles and edges
results.model_answer: Angular, with sharp angles and edges.
results.retrieved_context:
another type of fertiliser, even if the distribution is very similar! You can determine which spreading chart compares the best to the fertiliser you are using based on similar weight. Select the type of fertiliser from the spreading chart that is closest to the type of fertiliser that you are using. The characteristics of the various types of fertiliser are so far reaching that using a spreading chart for another type of fertiliser, even if the distribution is the same, could provide a bad spreading pattern and could harm the crop! 57 ================================================================================ Page 58 ================================================================================ ===Page 58=== To be done before spreading Determine the type of fertiliser based on the shape and surface: Type Operation pattern Surface 0 Granular rough roughly round, sometimes slightly angular, no sharp corners or edges rough 1 smooth roughly round, not angular, no sharp corners or edges relatively smooth 2 mineral angular, with sharp angles and edg- es very rough 3 prills perfectly round, hollow on the in- side, some holes in the surface very smooth 4 Crystalline oblong, cylindrical, some round pat- terns, hollow on the inside, some holes on the surface smooth 5 Blend blend of granules with various pat- terns, different
hollow on the inside, some holes on the surface smooth 5 Blend blend of granules with various pat- terns, different from above descrip- tions blend of granules with various surfaces, different from above de- scriptions 6 Pellets Pellets of organic material 7 Seed Slug pellets A seed can vary from species to species. A seed can have different charac- teristics. [Image] Granular [Image: Granular] prills Crystalline [Image: Crystalline] Blend [Image: Blend] 58 Pellets Seed Slug pellets [Image: Slug pellets] [Image] mineral [Image: mineral] [Image] ================================================================================ Page 59 ================================================================================ ===Page 59=== Determining distribution [Image] [Image] [Image] [Image] [Image] To be done before spreading The distribution is the ratio of granules with different diameters. A distribution meter comes with every spreader. This meter has 4 sections, with seven parts. The seven have different mesh width that divide the fertiliser granules, based on their diameters. Distribution of 0-70-30-0 indicates none of the granules has a diameter of less than 2.0 mm, 70% have a diameter between 2.0 - 3.3 mm, 30% have a diameter between 3.3 - 4.75 mm and none is larger than 4.75 mm. You should therefore do the following to determine the distribution of the fertiliser with the distribution meter:
depends on the characteristics of the fertiliser, not the brand! Determine the characteristics of the fertiliser, therefore, and find the spreading chart with similar features. Use the chart, even if the brand of the fertiliser differs from the nearest comparable fertiliser! Select the spreading chart based on the characteristics of the fertiliser and not on the brand! In order to find the correct spreading chart in the spreading chart book, online spreading chart service on the website, or via the free application (App) on your mobile phones, you must collect the following physical properties of the fertiliser Â· type and pattern of the granules ï‚® see the paragraph below,Â»Determine the type and pattern of the granulesÂ« Â· distribution (= composition of granules of various sizes), ï‚® see paragraph Â»Determining distributionÂ« on page 59, Â· similar weight, ï‚® See paragraph Â»Determining similar weightÂ« on page 60. Distribution is the most vital characteristic of the fertiliser when it comes to spreading. You can make the first selection from the (online) spreading charts based on the distribution. Never use a spreading chart for another type of fertiliser, even if the distribution is very similar! You can determine which spreading chart compares the best

most of the implement functions used can be operated centrally with one handle. This is available in addition to the ISOBUS terminal such as the IsoMatch. Handle control While working attention and visibility is often required to follow the work process. By locating the control buttons on the handle by touch, it will enable you to keep your eyes on the driving system control and remain focussed while driving. If operating buttons can be located by the sense of touch reaction speed can be increased and operating mistakes avoided. 44 functions under 11 buttons The IsoMatch Grip has 11 function buttons and one selector that are operated with the thumb and under which there are 44 functions. 35 ================================================================================ Page 36 ================================================================================ ===Page 36=== Getting familiar with the machine Technical specifications Exacta-TLX GEOSPREAD 1875 2550 3225 3900 0 General 1 Content of the hopper (l) 1875 2550 3225 3900 2 Filling level (cm) 122 141 160 179 3 Filling width (cm) 284 284 284 284 4 Hopper's width (cm) 290 290 290 290 5 Weight (kg) 705 735 765 795 6 Maximum load capacity (kg) 3900 7 Type of linkage pins Cat. other troughs 4 metres to the right of the tractor tracks. INDICATION Position the troughs horizontally with a spirit level! 78 ================================================================================ Page 79 ================================================================================ ===Page 79=== [Image] To be done before spreading ï€´ Start the tractor again. ï€´ Close all the doors and windows in the cabin. ï€´ Switch the control box on. ï€´ Enter the required application rate. ï€´ Enter the working width. It is recommended that an application rate of at least 250 kg/ha is entered with the selected driving speed. ï€´ Switch on the left spreading disc. ï€´ Switch off the automatic calibration. ï€´ Engage the PTO shaft and set the RPM of the spreading discs as given in the relevant spreading chart. ï€´ Open the right dosing unit. ï€´ Drive over the first trough and stop only after you have driven at least 20 metres past this trough. This is because the spreader distributes roughly even to the back, front and to the side. ï€´ Close the dosing unit. ï€´ Empty the trough with a funnel into the graduated tubes and record the reading in your notebook. Repeat the above procedure, but disconnect the right spreading disc and switch the dosing unit of the right
in the troughs. ï€´ Place trough 1 in the middle of the tractor tracks. INDICATION Position the troughs horizontally with a spirit level! ï€´ Divide the additional 6 buckets on the one side of the track over the actual working width of the spreader. The actual width is twice the size of the effective working width! If you want to spread over a working width of 24 metres, place the buckets at 24/6 metres = 4 metres. [Image] 81 ================================================================================ Page 82 ================================================================================ ===Page 82=== To be done before spreading ï€´ Start the tractor again. ï€´ Close all the doors and windows in the cabin. ï€´ Switch the control box on. ï€´ Enter the required application rate. ï€´ Key in the new value. ï€´ Enter the working width. It is recommended that an application rate of at least 250 kg/ha is entered with the selected driving speed. ï€´ Switch off the automatic calibration. ï€´ Engage the PTO shaft and set the RPM of the spreading discs as given in the relevant spreading chart. ï€´ Drive along the tracks and open the dosing units a few metres before you drive over the first bucket in the middle by pressing the start

results.question: How often (in what interval) must the condition of the vanes be inspected?
results.retrieved_context:
gear grease EP00/000 gear grease 1 Lubricate with grease Lubricate with oil 1 to 2 times Shell Rodina 2, Castrol GS2 or equivalent MIL-L-2105C, SAE 80W-90 124 ================================================================================ Page 125 ================================================================================ ===Page 125=== Maintenance intervals Maintenance Keep to the checking and maintenance intervals given below to keep the machine in good working order. da il y af te r th e first 10 hou rs we ekly ev ery 1 00 ho urs min. 1 x per ye ar As r eco mme nde d If worn Page 0 Inspection 1 Â»Checking bolts and nutsÂ« Â· Â· 130 2 Â»Checking the hydraulic systemÂ« Â· Â· 131 3 Condition of the agitator and the agitator axle Â· 4 Condition of the vanes Â· 43 5 Â»Checking and setting the dosing mechanismÂ« Â· Â· 133 6 Â»Checking and setting the discharge point setting mecha- nismÂ« Â· Â· 136 7 Â»Checking and setting the discharge bushing heightÂ« Â· 8 Â· 138 9 Lubrication 10 4 grease nipples on the PTO shaft Â· 126 11 2 grease nipples on both discharge bushings Â· 126 12 1 grease nipple on all four actuators Â· 126 13 Applying or adding grease 14 Coupling shafts profiled tubes
the spare parts manual. ï€´ Secure the wheels with the lock clips. Caster wheels may be placed on the side of the frame. This prevents the crop from being damaged while spreading. The spreader is provided with 12 vanes of equal length and 4 shorter. ï€´ Grease the threaded rods of the vanes. ï€´ Hook the short vanes into the correct position (see illustration). ï€´ Then place the other two vanes into the other positions. ï€´ Press the vanes in well and put the lock nut in position. ï€´ Place the vanes on the other side in the same manner. ï€´ Fasten the lock nuts (50NM) Even wear of the vanes The long vanes are positioned in groups of three. The first vane considered in the direction of rotation of the disc will wear out most quickly. TIP ï€´ Exchange the first vane after the fixed vane, and the short vane, over a period of time. ï€´ After a subsequent period, exchange the foremost vane at that time with the central vane. As a result, the vanes will wear evenly and the spreading pattern will remain optimal. 43 Short vane Short vane [Image: Short vaneShort vane] ================================================================================ Page 44 ================================================================================
and shoes. Working in an unsafe manner on the hydraulic system could lead to injury and damage to the machine. In the event of injury, contact your physician immediately! There is also the risk of infection! Before operating the hydraulic system, check all connections and hoses for damage and leakage. Regularly inspect the hydraulic system (hoses, pipes, connections). All hoses, piping and connecting points must be checked regularly, but at least once a year, by an expert for leakages or visible damage! The lifetime of a hose should be 6 years maximum (see the production date on the hoses). Damaged or old parts must be replaced with new ones that comply with the technical specifications of the manufacturer of the machine. Damage to the hydraulic system could lead to injury. 131 ================================================================================ Page 132 ================================================================================ ===Page 132=== Maintenance Inspection criteria Replacing instructions 132 It is not permitted to carry out repairs on hydraulic hoses! Replace hoses if the following is detected during inspection: Â· damage to the exterior up to the armouring (such as abrasion marks, cuts and tears), Â· the exterior becoming brittle (tears in the hose), Â· distortion not normal for the pattern of the hose while under

results.question: How often (in what interval) must the bushing height be checked and the discharge be set?
results.expected_answer: after the first 10 hours and every 100 hours, but a minimum of once per year
results.retrieved_context:
ï€´ Unscrew the bolts attaching the discharge bush to the star a few times. ï€´ Move the discharge bushing upwards or downwards until the distance to the spreading disc is 1.0 mm. You can also put 1.0 mm thick plates between the discharge bush and the spreading disc and lower the discharge bush onto them. ï€´ Turn on the bolts attaching the discharge bushing to the agitator axle star. ï€´ Check the height again and adjust it if necessary. ï€´ Lower the dosing mechanism by turning the fastening bolt nuts upward. Lower the dosing mechanism until the bayonet ring has moved halfway across the bolts attaching the discharge bushing to the star. ï€´ Check the position of the dosing mechanism relative to the agitator axle. The distance between the agitator axle and the sealing ring must be the same on all sides. ï‚® See paragraph Â»Checking and setting the dosing mechanismÂ« on page 133. ï€´ Turn on the lock nuts on 4 fastening bolts without moving the dosing mechanism again. ï€´ Check that the agitator is not in contact with the bolts attaching the agitator seal ring. ï€´ Reattach the dashboard with the three fixing knobs. ï€´ Perform the check
following: ï€´ Loosen the 2 bolts of the actuator plate slightly. ï€´ Slide the actuator plate until the distance between the inside of the rope and the opening of the discharge bushing is 109 mm. ï€´ Re-fasten the 2 bolts without sliding the actuator plate again. ï€´ Perform the check on the other side as well. ï€´ Secure the dashboard by fastening the 3 fixing knobs. [Image] 137 ================================================================================ Page 138 ================================================================================ ===Page 138=== Maintenance Checking and setting the discharge bushing height [Image] [Image] Spreading disc [Image: Spreading disc] Fixing knobs Dashboard [Image: Fixing knobsDashboard] [Image] 138 Avoid contact with the fertiliser and other material You will most likely get into contact with the fertiliser and other material you may wish to spread while filling, adjusting and testing the spreader. Wear protective clothing and safety gloves, read the safety instructions provided by the supplier and follow their directions. Contact with these materials could cause physical harm. Be careful that nothing gets jammed It is easy for parts to get jammed while adjusting and checking the spreader. results.question: What should I do if the flow of the fertiliser is blocked, at what page should I look?
results.expected_answer: Clean the machine well after each use. Replace the agitator if it is worn out. The page is 118
results.model_answer: Unknown or Not found in context
results.retrieved_context:
If you see damage to the vanes, spreading disc or discharge bushing, the failure is most likely caused by a hard object. The agitator is probably damaged too. You must first repair the damage or have it repaired before continuing with spreading.
ï€´ Place an object, for example a cloth or bag, in the discharge opening of the discharge bushing on the damaged side. . This will prevent you from wasting fertiliser during transport.
ï€´ Start the tractor and engage the control box. The dosing units will now close.
ï€´ Switch off the control box.
ï€´ Take all appropriate measures for road transport.
ï‚® See paragraph Â»Preparing the machine to be transportedÂ« on page 93.
On the site of a lockable storage depot:
ï€´ Empty the hopper without positioning the machine on the ground.
ï€´ Open the sieve closure with an attachment, standard supplied with the machine.
Lock the sieve in the open position
If you open the sieves, you should lock them to prevent unwanted closing. Accidental closure could lead to serious injury.
ï€´ Remove the object that caused the damage.
ï€´ Repair the machine or have your dealer do it.

stoppage

116
If you have not found any damage, the failure is probably due to stoppage from an encrusted layer of fertiliser.
ï€´ Try to reduce the size of the lump or encrusted layer with an object such as a stick, screwdriver or vane.
If you open the filters to reduce the lump or encrusted layer from the top side, you should block them to prevent unwanted closing.
If you can reduce the lump or encrusted layer in this way:
ï€´ Inspect the hopper contents for other lumps and reduce them.
ï€´ Fit the vanes and secure them with the lock nut.
ï€´ Check the discharge point setting.
ï€´ Close the hopper cover.
ï€´ Continue spreading.
If you have not managed to reduce the lump or encrusted layer because it is out of reach or there is no tool at your disposal:
ï€´ Close the hopper cover.
ï€´ Follow the working method as described in the previous paragraph Â»DamageÂ« until emptying the hopper.
ï€´ Remove or reduce the lump or encrusted layer.
ï€´ If necessary, dry the hopper and the dosing mechanism.
Opening the sieve clip
ï€´ Open the sieve closure with an attachment, standard supplied with the machine.
ï€´ Lock the sieve to prevent it from closing accidentally.
ï€´ Close the sieves and check the lock.
ï€´ Refill the spreader.
ï€´ Check the fertiliser for lumps before and after filling.
ï€´ Close the hopper cover.

Storing the machine
[Image]
[Image]
[Image]
Storing the machine
Avoid contact with the fertiliser and other material
It is easy to come into contact with the materials when putting away the machine. Always wear protective clothing, such as safety gloves, shoes and goggles. Read and adhere to the additional safety instructions and the of the material producer. Contact with the materials could lead to injury. Contact your physician in such an event!
Be careful that nothing gets jammed
It is also easy to get injured while working with the spreader. Work safely with the machine:
Â· releasing the pressure from the hydraulic system,
Â· switching off the electronic control system,
Â· switch the tractor off and remove the key from the ignition,
Â· engage the parking brake of the tractor,
Â· wait for all machine parts to come to a standstill before you approach it,
Â· wear protective clothing, such as safety gloves and shoes,
Â· carefully follow the instructions given.
Friction with these materials could cause physical injury.
Protect the machine
Fertiliser and other salts have a great influence on the rate of corrosion. Empty the hopper at the end of activities. Protect the machine by always cleaning it after using such material and patch breaks in the paint. Corrosion affects the strength of the construction and the operation of the machine, which could lead to a shortened lifespan. After cleaning, inject the (white) metal parts of the machine with the supplied preserving liquid point for protection against corrosion of the
machine, read the instructions before use.
Be careful while cleaning with high pressure cleaners
You can clean the machine

===Page 113===

Failure and stoppage
[Image]
Causes
Use in the field
Be careful that nothing gets jammed
It is also easy to get injured while working with the spreader. Work safely with the machine:
Â· releasing the pressure from the hydraulic system,
Â· switching off the electronic control system,
Â· switch the tractor off and remove the key from the ignition,
Â· engage the parking brake of the tractor,
Â· wait for all machine parts to come to a standstill before you approach it,
Â· wear protective clothing, such as safety gloves and shoes,
Â· carefully follow the instructions given.
Friction with these materials could cause physical injury.
Avoid contact with the fertiliser and other material
While working with the spreader, you might come into contact with fertiliser or other substances that you want to spread. Wear protective clothing and gloves, read the safety instructions provided by the supplier and follow their directions. Contact with these materials could cause physical harm.
During spreading, if you:
Â· see that a spreading disc is spreading irregularly or not at all while the dosing units are open,
Â· hear a loud noise,
Â· become aware that the machine is vibrating seriously,
Â· an alarm is shown on the main screen indicating that the PTO shaft is not connected, while it actually is connected,
Â· an alarm will appear on the main screen, indicating that the dosing units cannot be closed,
ï‚® see the software instruction manual.
Stop spreading immediately! Disconnect the PTO shaft immediately!
113

================================================================================
Page 114
================================================================================


===Page 114===

Use in the field
INDICATION
Working method
114
[Image]
INDICATION
These failures are probably caused by one of the following:
Â· a hard object blocks the agitator,
Â· a hard object or a large piece of fertiliser is (partially) blocking the supply from flowing to the agitator,
Â· a hard object or a large piece of fertiliser is (partially) blocking fertiliser from flowing through the dosing opening or discharge bushing,
Â· crushed and/or damp fertiliser forms an encrusted layer beneath the agitator and blocks the flow through the dosing openings,
Â· a lump of damp fertiliser has formed in the discharge bushing and is blocking flow from the discharge bushing opening. This happens especially when the spreader has not been thoroughly cleaned after it was last used.
Most types of fertiliser attract water and can thereby form large chunks. These chunks can block the spreader or distort the spreading pattern.
Â· When working under moist conditions, use a hopper cover that closes well.
Â· Do not spread without a hopper cover under moist conditions.
Â· Never leave the fertiliser for a long period of time in the spreader. Chunks can also be formed through moisture in the air.
Â· Always clean the spreader well after use, including the dosing openings and the discharge bushings.
Handle with care
Cautiously approach the machine and handle with care. There could be hot or live parts! Contact with these materials could cause physical injury.
To find the cause of the failure or stoppage and solve it as far as possible, proceed as follows.
ï€´ Disconnect the PTO shaft immediately!
ï€´ Switch off the electronic control system.
ï€´ Switch the tractor off, remove the key from the ignition and engage the handbrake of the tractor.
Do not place the machine on the ground. Placing a filled machine on the ground damages the structure!

Use in the field
ï€´ Examine the spreading discs and the discharge opening to see what the cause of the failure/stoppage is.
ï€´ Adapt the discharge point as needed for easier access.
ï€´ If you still cannot see the cause, carefully remove the vanes to see better into the discharge opening of the discharge bushing.
ï€´ Pass an object such as a screwdriver through the discharge opening and carefully feel if you can find an object in or damage to the dosing openings or agitator.
